business.headline: RBI introduces 'bank.in' domain for Indian banks to tackle financial fraudThe move aims to tackle growing financial fraud and cybercrime, prevent malicious activities, and strengthen the country's financial ecosystem.
RBI cuts key lending rate after 5 years: 6 takeaways from the announcementThe central bank has announced a reduction in the repo rate by 25 basis points for the first time in nearly five years.
After 5 years, RBI cut key lending rate by 25 basis points to 6.25%This marks the first rate cut since 2020 and the first policy decision under Governor Malhotra's leadership.

Home loans to get cheaper as RBI cuts rates. Check detailsThe RBI MPC reduced key lending rates by 25 basis points to 6.25%, the first rate cut in nearly five years under the leadership of newly appointed RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra.
RBI reduces key lending rate by 25 basis points to 6.25%The rate cut announced by the committee is the first since 2020. This was also the first policy meeting of Sanjay Malhotra as RBI Governor.

HDFC Bank UPI services unavailable on this date. Get details hereDuring the downtime, the UPI transactions on HDFC Bank's current and savings accounts and RuPay credit cards will be affected.

Explained: Why Swiggy shares hit record low todaySwiggy shares dropped over 7% to hit a new 52-week low of Rs 387 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) in early trade. At around 11:37 am, Swiggy shares were down 4.16% lower at Rs 400.70.

Delhi Lt Governor orders probe into AAP's 'Op Lotus' charge against BJPOn Thursday, party MP Sanjay Singh claimed that the BJP offered Rs 15 crore each to seven AAP candidates to switch sides. Without revealing their names, he alleged that the candidates even received phone calls from the BJP, a day after the elections to the 70-member Assembly took place.

Rahul Gandhi's Himachal twist while claiming anomaly in Maharashtra voter listRahul Gandhi, addressing a press briefing with Sanjay Raut and Supriya Sule, claimed in the five months between the Lok Sabha and Assembly polls, 39 lakh new voters were added in Maharashtra.

Injured Air Force pilot radios in after crash: 'Joshi, Jadhav bol raha hun'An Indian Air Force Mirage-2000 fighter jet crashed in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district due to a system malfunction. Both pilots ejected safely with minor injuries. A viral video captured one pilot reporting the crash to Gwalior Airbase.

Why a troubled Nehru restricted free speech with first amendment of ConstitutionIt was in 1951 that India's first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, amended the Constitution for the first time, because the "Constitution came in the way" of urgent social changes. A look at what led to the first amendment of the Constitution, which curtailed the absolute freedom of speech.
